title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement contact@katilingban.io. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing
text: Submit issue issues page

title: Anthropometric measurement standardisation tests
text: anthrocheckr provides functions : Calculating standard summaries intra-observer inter-observer measurements; Calculating intra-observer inter-observer technical error measurement (TEM) multiple subjects multiple measurers/observers; Calculating multiple measurers/observers relative technical error measurement (relative TEM); Calculating intra-observer total technical error measurement (total TEM); Calculating coefficient reliability; , Calculating bias measurements/observation gold standard.

title: Anthropometric measurement standardisation tests
text: anthrocheckr yet CRAN can installed nutriverse R Universe follows:

title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: standardisation test evaluates precision accuracy measurements taken survey personnel. accuracy measurements taken survey personnel determined close true value repeated measurements. hand, precision measurements taken survey personnel determined similar values repeated measurements made. preparation nutrition survey survey personnel training, aim survey personnel highly accurate highly precise anthropometric measurements.

title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: general process standardisation test survey personnel take measurements least 10 children 6-59 months, twice, interval time first second measurements.

title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: following test parameters need followed conducting anthropometric standardisation test: type equipment must used standardisation test survey child measured equipment supervisor must observe measurements taken Survey personnel measurements compared reference (supervisor) values Survey personnel measurements compared repeated measures taken (intra-observer)

title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: following test organisation requirements need met order conduct credible standardisation test: Spacious shady area Healthy children 6 59 months according age group targeted survey Incentives provided mother children Survey personnel grouped pairs, personnel carry measurements turn one pair survey personnel per child time test survey personnel given unique ID. example 20 survey personnel, unique ID 1 20 given survey personnel. supervisor’s ID always 0. measurement station height board, weighing scale MUAC tape child must remain mother fixed station unique ID number. example 10 mother children pairs, unique ID 1 10 given pair allowed pairs survey personnel speak pairs test

title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: order follow test parameters specified organise test appropriately, considerable amount time needs set aside conducting test. survey team 20 survey personnel, test can carried 2 half-days half survey personnel (first half team) measures 10 children morning half (second half team) measures 10 children afternoon. possible different set 10 children afternoon session. However, results first half took test morning combined results second half took test afternoon. larger scale surveys survey personnel 20, days required conduct test appropriately correct specifications.

what: Steps in carrying out the standardisation test
title: Anthropometric measurements standardisation test
text: supervisor carefully performs measurements child without allowing teams see values. supervisor records /measurements standardisation test form first round measurements. team starts different child, first half team measures child records results standard form first measurement (). current measurer make sure /entering data row corresponding child ID child /currently measuring. first half team done measurements current child, move next child. first half teams measured 10 children , first measurement round forms handed . teams children take break. Appropriate incentives including food drinks snack break provided mothers children. break, first half team repeats whole process measures child second time records /measurements onto standardisation test form second round measurements. first half teams measured 10 children twice, second measurement round forms handed . teams children take break lunch (end first half day/first half test). Appropriate lunch arrangements prepared mothers children. lunch break new day altogether, whole process done time, second half teams performing measurements. Ideally, set mother child pairs utilised second half day testing. However, may mothers unable come back help. second half day testing mother child pairs different first half day, measurements made second half day mixed data first half day reporting performance standardisation test survey personnel.

what: Intra-observer TEM for two measurements, and inter-observer TEM involving two measurers
title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: TEM=∑D22N TEM ~ = ~ \sqrt{\frac{\sum D ^ 2}{2N}}  D=difference measurementsD ~ = ~ \text{difference measurements} N=number individuals measuredN ~ = ~ \text{number individuals measured}

what: Inter-observer TEM with more than two observers
title: Technical Error of Measurement
text:
TEM=∑1N(∑1KM2−(∑1KM)2/KN(K−1)) TEM ~ = ~ \sqrt{\sum
olimits_1 ^ N \left (\sum
olimits_1 ^ K  M ^ 2 ~ - ~  rac{\left (\sum
olimits_1 ^ K M ight ) ^ 2 / K}{N(K ~ - ~ 1)} ight )}    N=Number subjectsN ~ = ~ 	ext{Number subjects} K=Number observersK ~ = ~ 	ext{Number observers} M=MeasurementM ~ = ~ 	ext{Measurement}

title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: %TEM=TEMmean×100 \% ~ TEM ~ = ~ \frac{TEM}{mean} ~ \times ~ 100

what: Total TEM for two observers and two measurements per observer
title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: Total TEM=TEM×(intra1)2+TEM×(intra2)22+TEM×(inter)2 \text{Total TEM} ~ = ~ \sqrt{\frac{TEM ~ \times ~ (intra_1) ^ 2 ~ + ~ TEM ~ \times ~ (intra_2) ^ 2}{2} ~ + ~ TEM \times (inter) ^ 2}

what: Total TEM for three observers and two measurements per observer
title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: Total TEM=TEM×(intra1)2+TEM×(intra2)2+TEM×(intra3)23+TEM×inter2 \text{Total TEM} ~ = ~ \sqrt{\frac{TEM ~ \times ~ (intra_1) ^ 2 ~ + ~ TEM ~ \times ~ (intra_2) ^ 2 ~ + ~ TEM ~ \times ~ (intra_3) ^ 2}{3} ~ + ~ TEM ~ \times ~ inter ^ 2}

title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: %Total TEM=Total TEMmean×100 \% ~ \text{Total TEM} ~ =  ~ \frac{\text{Total TEM}}{mean} ~ \times ~ 100

title: Technical Error of Measurement
text: R=1−Total TEM2SD2 R ~ = ~ 1 ~ - ~ \frac{\text{Total TEM} ^ 2}{SD ^ 2}

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ernest Guevarra. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ernest Guevarra (2024). anthrocheckr: Implementation Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://nutriverse.io/anthrocheckr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {anthrocheckr: An Implementation of Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests},   author = {{Ernest Guevarra}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://nutriverse.io/anthrocheckr/}, }

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: Ensuring precision accuracy measurements critical collecting anthropometric data. Anthropometrists usually tested precision accuracy measurement standardisation tests performed prior anthropometric data collection. package provides functions calculate inter- intra-observer technical error measurement (TEM) assess precision measurements.

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: anthrocheckr provides functions : Calculating standard summaries intra-observer inter-observer measurements; Calculating intra-observer inter-observer technical error measurement (TEM) multiple subjects multiple measurers/observers; Calculating multiple measurers/observers relative technical error measurement (relative TEM); Calculating intra-observer total technical error measurement (total TEM); Calculating coefficient reliability; , Calculating bias measurements/observation gold standard.

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: anthrocheckr yet CRAN can installed nutriverse R Universe follows:

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: mean, standard deviation, maximum difference measurements requisite summary measures various anthropometric measurement standardisations tests. can calculated follows:
code: ## Intra-observer mean for weight ---- weight_df <- subset(smartStdLong, subset = measure_type == "weight")  calculate_mean(weight_df$measure_value, index = weight_df$observer) #>    index   mean #> 1      0 14.655 #> 2      1 14.410 #> 3      2 14.560 #> 4      3 14.580 #> 5      4 14.545 #> 6      5 14.285 #> 7      6 14.650 #> 8      7 14.665 #> 9      8 14.650 #> 10     9 14.650 #> 11    10 14.615 ## Intra-observer sd for weight ---- calculate_sd(weight_df$measure_value, index = weight_df$observer) #>    index       sd #> 1      0 1.793988 #> 2      1 1.742926 #> 3      2 1.753913 #> 4      3 1.757870 #> 5      4 1.743703 #> 6      5 2.024657 #> 7      6 1.764116 #> 8      7 1.691861 #> 9      8 1.810932 #> 10     9 1.735238 #> 11    10 1.699311 ## Intra-observer max difference for weight ---- weight_df_wide <- tidyr::pivot_wider(   weight_df,    names_from = c(measure_type, measure_round),    values_from = measure_value, names_sep = "_" )  calculate_max(   abs(weight_df_wide$weight_1 - weight_df_wide$weight_2),    index = weight_df_wide$observer ) #>    index max_diff #> 1      0      0.2 #> 2      1      0.8 #> 3      2      0.3 #> 4      3      0.2 #> 5      4      0.5 #> 6      5      6.2 #> 7      6      0.5 #> 8      7      0.4 #> 9      8      0.4 #> 10     9      0.4 #> 11    10      0.9

what: Calculate intra-observer and inter-observer technical error of measurement (TEM)
title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: gives gives
code: ## Inter-observer max difference for weight ---- weight_df_wide <- tidyr::pivot_wider(   weight_df,    names_from = c(measure_type, measure_round),    values_from = measure_value, names_sep = "_" )  inter_tem <- calculate_tem(   abs(weight_df_wide$weight_1 - weight_df_wide$weight_2),    n = nrow(weight_df_wide) ) #> [1] 0.4507065 ## Intra-observer max difference for weight ---- weight_df_wide <- tidyr::pivot_wider(   weight_df,    names_from = c(measure_type, measure_round),    values_from = measure_value, names_sep = "_" )  intra_tem <- calculate_tem_cohort(   df = weight_df_wide, m1 = "weight_1", m2 = "weight_2",   index = "observer", n = nrow(weight_df_wide) ) #>    observer        tem #> 1         0 0.02430862 #> 2         1 0.10180195 #> 3         2 0.03567530 #> 4         3 0.01906925 #> 5         4 0.05090097 #> 6         5 0.41849297 #> 7         6 0.04156047 #> 8         7 0.03089572 #> 9         8 0.03437758 #> 10        9 0.03302891 #> 11       10 0.08867715

what: Calculating relative technical error of measurement
title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
code: mean_weight <- calculate_mean(   weight_df$measure_value, index = weight_df$observer )  calculate_relative_tem(intra_tem$tem, mean_weight$mean) #>  [1] 0.1658725 0.7064674 0.2450227 0.1307905 0.3499551 2.9295973 #>  [7] 0.2836892 0.2106766 0.2346593 0.2254533 0.6067543

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: use anthrocheckr package work, please cite using suggested citation provided call citation() function follows:
code: citation("anthrocheckr") #> To cite anthrocheckr in publications use: #>  #>   Ernest Guevarra (2024). _anthrocheckr: An Implementation of #>   Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests_. R #>   package version 0.0.0.9000, #>   <https://nutriverse.io/anthrocheckr/>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {anthrocheckr: An Implementation of Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests}, #>     author = {{Ernest Guevarra}}, #>     year = {2024}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, #>     url = {https://nutriverse.io/anthrocheckr/}, #>   }

title: Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests
text: Feedback, bug reports feature requests welcome; file issues seek support . like contribute package, please see contributing guidelines. Please note anthrocheckr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: An Implementation of Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests — anthrocheckr
title: An Implementation of Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests — anthrocheckr
text: Ensuring precision accuracy measurements critical collecting anthropometric data. Anthropometrists usually tested precision accuracy measurement standardisation tests performed prior anthropometric data collection. package provides functions calculate inter- intra-observer technical error measurement (TEM) assess precision measurements.

title: An Implementation of Anthropometric Measurement Standardisation Tests — anthrocheckr
text: Maintainer: Ernest Guevarra ernest@guevarra.io (ORCID)

what: Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
title: Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
text: Calculate coefficient reliability (R).

title: Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
text: total_tem numeric value total TEM sd numeric vector standard deviation measurements

title: Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
text: numeric vector coefficient reliability values per observer

title: Calculate the coefficient of reliability (R). — calculate_coeff_r
code: # Calculate intra-observer TEM intra <- calculate_tem_cohort(df = smartStd,                               m1 = "muac1",                               m2 = "muac2",                               index = "observer",                               n = 11)  # Get inter-observer TEM muacDF1 <- subset(smartStd,                   select = c(-muac2, -weight1, -weight2, -height1, -height2)) muacDF2 <- subset(smartStd,                   select = c(-muac1, -weight1, -weight2, -height1, -height2))  # Spread the dataset to wide format library(tidyr) muacDF1 <- tidyr::spread(muacDF1, key = "observer", value = "muac1") muacDF2 <- tidyr::spread(muacDF2, key = "observer", value = "muac2") muacDF <- merge(muacDF1, muacDF2, by = "subject") inter <- calculate_team_tem(n = 10, k = 22, m = muacDF[ , 2:23])  total_tem <- calculate_total_tem(intra = intra, inter = inter) #> Warning: ‘^’ not meaningful for factors  # Calculate sd stdev <- calculate_sd(   measures = subset(smartStdLong, measure_type == "muac")$measure_value,   index = subset(smartStdLong, measure_type == "muac")$observer )  calculate_coeff_r(total_tem = total_tem, sd = stdev) #> Warning: ‘/’ not meaningful for factors #>    index sd #> 1     NA NA #> 2     NA NA #> 3     NA NA #> 4     NA NA #> 5     NA NA #> 6     NA NA #> 7     NA NA #> 8     NA NA #> 9     NA NA #> 10    NA NA #> 11    NA NA

what: Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
title: Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
text: Calculate relative TEM measurements multiple observers.

title: Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
text: tem numeric vector data frame technical error measurements produced applying [calculate_tem_cohort()]. mean_value numeric vector data frame mean measurements produced applying [calculate_mean()].

title: Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
text: vector data frame calculated relative TEM per observer   per measurement type.

title: Calculate relative TEM of measurements by multiple observers. — calculate_relative_tem
code: ## Calculate relative TEM for weight using the smartStd dataset   tem <- calculate_tem_cohort(df = smartStd,                               m1 = "weight1",                               m2 = "weight2",                               index = "observer",                               n = 10)    x <- smartStdLong[smartStdLong$measure_type == "weight", ]    mean_value <- calculate_mean(     measures = x$measure_value, index = x[ , "observer"]   )    rel_tem <- calculate_relative_tem(     tem = tem$tem, mean_value = mean_value$mean   )      rel_tem #>  [1] 0.5501370 2.3430872 0.8126483 0.4337829 1.1606699 9.7163749 0.9408907 #>  [8] 0.6987351 0.7782767 0.7477441 2.0123765

what: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
title: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
text: Get mean, sd maximum difference value measurements/observations made single observer across multiple subjects

title: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
code: calculate_mean(measures, index = NULL)  calculate_sd(measures, index = NULL)  calculate_max(measures, index = NULL)

title: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
text: measures vector measurements/observations made single observer across multiple subjects index character vector length equal `measures` specifying factors used group measurements/values applying summary function. single observer, tend type measurement made `measures` vector measurements/observations different types e.g., weight height. *optional* set NULL default. indicate summary metrics made values `measures` without grouping.

title: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
text: numeric value summary measure measurements/observations   `index` NULL. named numeric vector summary measure   measurements/observations grouped factor specified `index`

title: Calculate the mean, sd and maximum difference value of measurements/observations — calculate_mean
code: ## Get the mean of weight measurements by observer 0 (supervisor) from the ## smartStd dataset x <- smartStd[smartStd$observer == 0, ] calculate_mean(c(x$weight1, x$weight2)) #> [1] 14.655  ## Get the mean weight, height and muac measurements by observer 0 from the ## smartStdLong dataset x <- smartStdLong[smartStdLong$observer == 0, ] calculate_mean(x$measure_value, x$measure_type) #>    index    mean #> 1 height  95.495 #> 2   muac 164.350 #> 3 weight  14.655  ## Get the sd of weight measurements by observer 0 (supervisor) from the ## smartStd dataset x <- smartStd[smartStd$observer == 0, ] calculate_sd(c(x$weight1, x$weight2)) #> [1] 1.793988  ## Get the sd of weight, height and muac measurements by observer 0 from the ## smartStdLong dataset x <- smartStdLong[smartStdLong$observer == 0, ] calculate_sd(x$measure_value, x$measure_type) #>    index       sd #> 1 height 4.953306 #> 2   muac 9.626034 #> 3 weight 1.793988  ## Get the max difference of weight measurements by observer 0 (supervisor) ## from the smartStd dataset x <- smartStd[smartStd$observer == 0, ] calculate_max(abs(x$weight1 - x$weight2)) #> [1] 0.07378648  ## Get the max difference of weight, height and muac measurements by observer ## 0 from the smartStd dataset x <- smartStd[smartStd$observer == 0, ] calculate_max(c(abs(x$weight1 - x$weight2),                 abs(x$height1 - x$height2),                 abs(x$muac1 - x$muac2)),               c(rep("weight", 10), rep("height", 10), rep("muac", 10))) #>    index max_diff #> 1 height      2.2 #> 2   muac     11.0 #> 3 weight      0.2

what: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) for two or more observers — calculate_team_tem
title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) for two or more observers — calculate_team_tem
text: Function calculate technical error measurement (TEM) two observers involved.

text: n numeric value specifying number subjects k numeric value specifying number observers m data frame measurements number columns equal `k` number rows equal `n`

title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) for two or more observers — calculate_team_tem
text: numeric value technical error measurement (TEM). Unit     TEM unit measurements compared.

title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) for two or more observers — calculate_team_tem
code: # calculate team TEM from stature dataset calculate_team_tem(n = 10, k = 4, m = stature[ , c("m1", "m2", "m3", "m4")]) #> [1] 0.003063223

what: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
text: Function calculate **technical error measurement (TEM)** based formula created *Ulijaszek Kerr (1999)* indicator measurement precision described *Mueller Mortorell (1998)*. function specific intra-observer TEM two measurements, inter-observer TEM involving two measurers.

title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
text: d Numeric vector difference two measurements made measurer two measurers. n Numeric value number individuals measured.

title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
text: numeric value technical error measurement (TEM). Unit     TEM unit measurements compared.

title: Calculate technical error of measurement (TEM) — calculate_tem
code: ## Apply calculate_tem to smartStd dataset to get TEM for weight for ## supervisor x <- smartStd[smartStd$observer == 0, ] difference <- x$weight1 - x$weight2 tem <- calculate_tem(d = difference, n = length(difference)) tem #> [1] 0.08062258

what: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
title: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
text: Function calculate *intra-observer TEM* observer using input dataset containing multiple types multiple measurements multiple observers.

title: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
code: calculate_tem_cohort(df, m1, m2, index = NULL, n)

title: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
text: df data.frame containing data multiple measurements made multiple observers multiple subjects m1 character value variable `df` containing initial round measurements made multiple observers m2 character value variable `df` containing subsequent round measurements made multiple observers index character value vector specifying variable name/s `df` containing factors used group results . multiple observers, least two variable  names provided observer identifiers. variable `df` used grouping factor included. *optional* set NULL default. indicate summary metrics made values `measures` without grouping n Number subjects measured

title: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
text: data frame calculated TEM per observer per     measurement type.

title: Calculate intra-observer TEM for each observer — calculate_tem_cohort
code: # Get the TEM per observer for MUAC measurements in the smartStd dataset calculate_tem_cohort(df = smartStd,                      m1 = "muac1", m2 = "muac2",                      index = "observer", n = 10) #>    observer       tem #> 1         0  3.694591 #> 2         1  2.428992 #> 3         2  2.819574 #> 4         3 29.631908 #> 5         4  3.674235 #> 6         5  8.941476 #> 7         6  3.008322 #> 8         7  7.641989 #> 9         8  3.232646 #> 10        9  2.313007 #> 11       10  2.037155

what: Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
title: Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
text: Calculate Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM.

title: Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
text: intra numeric vector data frame individual intra-observer TEM. inter numeric value inter-observer TEM.

title: Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
text: numeric value total TEM

title: Calculate the Total TEM given individual intra-observer TEM. — calculate_total_tem
code: # Calculate intra-observer TEM intra <- calculate_tem_cohort(df = smartStd,                               m1 = "muac1",                               m2 = "muac2",                               index = "observer",                               n = 11)  # Get inter-observer TEM muacDF1 <- subset(smartStd,                   select = c(-muac2, -weight1, -weight2, -height1, -height2)) muacDF2 <- subset(smartStd,                   select = c(-muac1, -weight1, -weight2, -height1, -height2))  # Spread the dataset to wide format library(tidyr) muacDF1 <- tidyr::spread(muacDF1, key = "observer", value = "muac1") muacDF2 <- tidyr::spread(muacDF2, key = "observer", value = "muac2") muacDF <- merge(muacDF1, muacDF2, by = "subject") inter <- calculate_team_tem(n = 10, k = 22, m = muacDF[ , 2:23])  total_tem <- calculate_total_tem(intra = intra, inter = inter) #> Warning: ‘^’ not meaningful for factors

what: Calculate bias of a measurement — estimate_bias
title: Calculate bias of a measurement — estimate_bias
text: Calculate bias measurement gold standard. Two gold standards used function: 1) measurements made supervisor known expert; , 2) median measurements made observers.

title: Calculate bias of a measurement — estimate_bias
Calculate bias of a measurement — estimate_bias
text: msur numeric value vector mean measurements observers msup numeric value vector mean measurements supervisor mall numeric value vector median measurements observers

title: Calculate bias of a measurement — estimate_bias

title: Standardisation test data - sample 1 — smartStd
text: data frame 8 columns 110 rows: | **Variable** | **Description** | | :— | :— | | *subject* | Unique identifier subjects measured | | *observer* | Unique identifier performed measurements | | *weight1* | First weight measurement. Units kilograms | | *weight2* | Second weight measurement. Units kilograms | | *height1* | First height measurement. Units centimetres | | *height2* | Second height measurement. Units centimetres | | *muac1* | First mid-upper arm circumference measurement. Units millimetres | | *muac* | Second mid-upper arm circumference measurement. Units millimetres |
